title: ElectraBets
author: ElectraBets
content: Min - Blazers under 226.5Hawks Mavs under 242.5Bucks - 76ers under 2340-0 so far

comments.author: wheelz1200
comments.body: There is already an nba betting thread that would probably fit where you want to put this.  Easy to keep track in one thread rather than opening up multiple.  Here's the link to the thread:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5091185.0By the way any reason you like the unders so much.  I feel like all the overs have been hitting lately?

comments.author: ElectraBets
comments.body: 2-1 today:Nets MLNew Orleans Pelicans v Sacramento Kings under 237.5Memphis Grizzlies v Portland Trail Blazers: under 237

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: I agree with wheelz1200. Join us there, the more members sharing their bets, the merrier. Don't worry, everyone is welcome there. I would gladly share my opinions about your picks if ever I find the time or if we have the same bets because I had been also targetting those over and under but mostly in a parlay to increase the profits.Quote from: ElectraBets on April 04, 2023, 10:51:04 AM2-1 today:Nets MLNew Orleans Pelicans v Sacramento Kings under 237.5Memphis Grizzlies v Portland Trail Blazers: under 237I like the Pelicans versus Kings under bet because there's a chance the Pelicans would be forcing the win and their defense will be intensified. As for the Grizzlies vs Trail Blazers, I might go the other way as it could become an All-Star shooting mania for a no-bearing game.

comments.author: ElectraBets
comments.body: Sorry guys I'm staying here because I would like to keep track of my record with a model I've created:)4-2 Dallas Mavericks v Sacramento Kings under 245.5Milwaukee Bucks v Chicago Bulls under 231.5New Orleans Pelicans v Memphis Grizzlies over 232.5

comments.author: inthelongrun
comments.body: Quote from: ElectraBets on April 05, 2023, 10:04:05 AMSorry guys I'm staying here because I would like to keep track of my record with a model I've created:)4-2 Dallas Mavericks v Sacramento Kings under 245.5Milwaukee Bucks v Chicago Bulls under 231.5New Orleans Pelicans v Memphis Grizzlies over 232.5Since it's been over a week already that I haven't had a bet, I will copy your 3 picks. Good luck with the bets. By the way, it would be better if you also add the odds gained/lost. Because tracking your win-loss at 4-2 alone does not reflect your gains and losses due to the house edge. Let's say the odds of your previous bets were at 1.85 then it means you are at a profit of 1.40 odds/points. This is just a suggestion so no pressure anyways as you might also have different amounts per bet.0.85*4=3.40 winnings1*2=2 losses3.40-2 =1.40 net gain.

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: Quote from: ElectraBets on April 05, 2023, 10:04:05 AMSorry guys I'm staying here because I would like to keep track of my record with a model I've created:)4-2 Dallas Mavericks v Sacramento Kings under 245.5Milwaukee Bucks v Chicago Bulls under 231.5New Orleans Pelicans v Memphis Grizzlies over 232.5No problem at all, it's just an invitation and there's no forcing anyone.  I actually like all of your picks for today. I would gladly tail all three of them and see where it will go. Maybe even go for a parlay to make the profits more attractive. I think the over 220.5 for the Detroit Pistons versus the Brooklyn Nets is also a good pick so I am taking that on a single bet only. Most of the Pistons' games are 100 points and above. While when the Brooklyn Nets are winning it's mostly 120+ so this could really hit.Good luck to you and may you win all your bets.

comments.author: Hypnosis00
comments.body: Good luck, @ElectraBets! I hope you continue this thread as you keep betting on the NBA. If you end up having a positive record - at least over 53% - your record will certainly attract followers. Over/under betting is similar to spread betting, but it's best to go with what you are comfortable with.I'm keeping an eye on this.

This is just a suggestion so no pressure anyways as you might also have different amounts per bet.0.85*4=3.40 winnings1*2=2 losses3.40-2 =1.40 net gain.Well yeah I could add up the units if thats what people want.Nice hit with nets over @danherbias077-2 so farPhiladelphia 76ers vs Miami Heat: under 221.5 Utah Jazz vs Oklahoma City Thunder over 234.5

comments.author: inthelongrun
comments.body: Quote from: ElectraBets on April 06, 2023, 09:48:31 AMQuote from: inthelongrun on April 05, 2023, 10:59:56 AMQuote from: ElectraBets on April 05, 2023, 10:04:05 AMSorry guys I'm staying here because I would like to keep track of my record with a model I've created:)4-2 Dallas Mavericks v Sacramento Kings under 245.5Milwaukee Bucks v Chicago Bulls under 231.5New Orleans Pelicans v Memphis Grizzlies over 232.5Since it's been over a week already that I haven't had a bet, I will copy your 3 picks. Good luck with the bets. By the way, it would be better if you also add the odds gained/lost. Because tracking your win-loss at 4-2 alone does not reflect your gains and losses due to the house edge. Let's say the odds of your previous bets were at 1.85 then it means you are at a profit of 1.40 odds/points. This is just a suggestion so no pressure anyways as you might also have different amounts per bet.0.85*4=3.40 winnings1*2=2 losses3.40-2 =1.40 net gain.Well yeah I could add up the units if thats what people want.Nice hit with nets over @danherbias077-2 so farPhiladelphia 76ers vs Miami Heat: under 221.5 Utah Jazz vs Oklahoma City Thunder over 234.5 Congratulations mate! That was a solid 3-0. Thanks as well for sharing your tips here. I am tailing again but only the Philadelphia 76ers vs Miami Heat this time. It seems like the oddsmakers just realized Jazz vs Thunder over 234.5 is a steal. I only have 236.5, 237.5, and 238.50 here. GLHF for these games.Standing: 3-0Gains(+)/Losses(-): +2.66It is up to you if you include the units in your tracks mate. And with regards to the same thread that is already existing, to avoid possible deletion from an admin, maybe you just simply change the title of the thread to "ElectraBets NBA unders/overs tips". This would clearly distinguish your thread from the other existing thread.

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: Quote from: ElectraBets on April 06, 2023, 09:48:31 AMWell yeah I could add up the units if thats what people want.Nice hit with nets over @danherbias077-2 so farPhiladelphia 76ers vs Miami Heat: under 221.5 Utah Jazz vs Oklahoma City Thunder over 234.5 Thanks to you!  I like the suggestion of others, but since this is your thread, you can decide on what you want. Perhaps, it will also help with the tracking that you are doing. I made your tip in a parlay and it's a hit. Well appreciated. Somehow this stops my long streak of losing in the over and under section.  I am in doubt about the 76ers vs the Heat under 221.5 but I will tail it too. Will just avoid a parlay for now and keep in singles.I don't see over 234.5 in my favorite sports bookie for the Jazz vs Thunder. The lowest is 236.5 so I will just have to stick with that.

comments.author: inthelongrun
comments.body: Quote from: monedauno on May 04, 2023, 10:33:49 AMThe like they will be able to do it in the first half of the season. I don't know who is going to win the game, but I am not going to lie to you.Mis is a tough one to take on the most important game of the season. The Spurs have been playing well for most of the season, but they haven't been the best team in the Eastern Conference. They need to improve their defensive play and that is going to be a key part of their game.Min - Blazers under 226.5  Hawks Mavs under 242.5  Bucks - 76ers under 234    0-0 so farThe best part of this season has been to get a win on the road against the Spurs. They are in the midst of a playoff run and it looksWeird. Are you a bot? But I doubt a bot can post like that. If not, what are you talking about mate? It seems like you came from a different dimension. The NBA is already in the conference semi-finals stage. Min (if you meant Minnesota), Blazers, and Mavs failed to qualify in the playoffs earlier. The Bucks are already out in the first round but it was the Miami Heat that beat them, not the 76ers.

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: Quote from: inthelongrun on May 04, 2023, 11:17:45 AMQuote from: monedauno on May 04, 2023, 10:33:49 AMThe like they will be able to do it in the first half of the season. I don't know who is going to win the game, but I am not going to lie to you.Mis is a tough one to take on the most important game of the season. The Spurs have been playing well for most of the season, but they haven't been the best team in the Eastern Conference. They need to improve their defensive play and that is going to be a key part of their game.Min - Blazers under 226.5  Hawks Mavs under 242.5  Bucks - 76ers under 234    0-0 so farThe best part of this season has been to get a win on the road against the Spurs. They are in the midst of a playoff run and it looksWeird. Are you a bot? But I doubt a bot can post like that. If not, what are you talking about mate? It seems like you came from a different dimension. The NBA is already in the conference semi-finals stage. Min (if you meant Minnesota), Blazers, and Mavs failed to qualify in the playoffs earlier. The Bucks are already out in the first round but it was the Miami Heat that beat them, not the 76ers.Might be guessing things. We are now on the semi-finals and things are getting more interesting in NBA. Should be a closed thread I guess. But to those who are into NBA League especially this year wherein there are many changes with rosters,  betting is becoming more loud recently. One is with LAL and GSW who were rivals before. Odds are to LAL for game 2 even if they have won the first game and that is probably because of the homecourt advantage. Odds are simply the heart of the polls and will never dictate the outcome but could be an edge to gamblers as we all know. Die hard fans of each team are more likely pushing their biases to finals and the trophy itself. Glad that this season is havaing the hype as before.

Odds are simply the heart of the polls and will never dictate the outcome but could be an edge to gamblers as we all know. Die hard fans of each team are more likely pushing their biases to finals and the trophy itself. Glad that this season is havaing the hype as before.Well, none of those guesses made it. The teams were not even accurate.This playoffs is a little different. Dangerous well-experienced teams like GSW, Miami, and Lakers are in the bottom seeds and somehow managed to upset the top seeds.Lakers vs GSW is really a close series. Prior to its start, I can say GSW only has a 55/45 slight edge. I already made a bet of -6.5 on GSW. They lost game 1 but it was close. And they badly needed a win before traveling to Los Angeles for the next 2 games. Money can be a factor to change odds because the house will try to balance its bets from both sides.

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.body: ^Guys. @monedauno copied that betting part from the first post of @ElectraBets. I don't know his purpose, he may be trying to quote him but failed to do so or just spamming everywhere. I am going with spamming because in other parts of it, he doesn't know what he is talking about.  Anyway, the OP of this thread had been inactive after the season ended. We don't know if he will ever be back again. It's actually a waste because he is having some good picks to share and I also made some profits from tailing them. Let's see if he will come back the next season and continue this thread of his. He said it was to keep track of his records but I think he got busy or maybe just got bored of what he started here.
